text: {{Infobox writer | name = María Elena Walsh | image = María Elena Walsh 1965.jpg | caption = Walsh in 1965 | alt = | partner = Sara Facio (1978–2011) | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = Ramos Mejía, Argentina | death_date = | death_place = Buenos Aires, Argentina | occupation = Poet, author, musician, writer | genre = Children's literature, Autobiographical novel, poetry | signature = María Elena Walsh firma.png }} María Elena Walsh (1 February 1930 – 10 January 2011) was an Argentine poet, novelist, musician, playwright, writer and composer. She was known for her songs and books for children. Walsh's partner from 1978 until her death in 2011 was Sara Facio, an Argentine photographer.Murió María Elena Walsh, Clarín, 10 January 2011 Walsh died of bone cancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina on 10 January 2011 at the age of 80. ==References== ==Other websites== *Biography at the Ministry of Education of Argentina (Spanish) *"María Elena Walsh y la opinión urgente", ensayistas.org; accessed 2 January 2018. *Interview with Sara Facio, escritorasunidas.blogspot.com, April 2011 * Obituaries: BA Times, ABC News, LAHT *Videos editados en 3D y otros desde Youtube (Spanish) * Category:1930 births Category:2011 deaths Category:Deaths from bone cancer Category:Argentine poets Category:Argentine playwrights Category:Argentine composers Category:Writers from Buenos Aires Category:Musicians from Buenos Aires Category:LGBT musicians Category:LGBT poets Category:LGBT playwrights Category:Children's writers Category:Lesbian feminists Category:Singers from Buenos Aires
title: María Elena Walsh
